Text.2309: It's in rediscovering its roots that #Europe will really flourish. Lord Griffiths of Fforestfach @SG__Symposium #brexit #46SGS #debategrowth
Text.2310: We would miss the talent of the people of the #EU when exiting. Mark Boleat @SG__Symposium #Brexit #46SGS #debategrowth
Text.2311: Brussels has to recreate the spiritual vision of #Europe that inspired people. Lord Griffiths of Fforestfach #brexit #46SGS
Text.2312: Whatever the outcome of this #referendum. We have a turbulent period ahead of us. Lord Griffiths of Fforestfach #brexit #46SGS #debategrowth
Text.2313: Referendum 1975: EU was seen as t/ future. Where growth & innovation would come from. Cameron did not use these terms again. #brexit #46SGS
Text.2314: We c Brussels as a too much welfaresque entity. Ld. Griffiths of Fforestfach. #BREXIT a case 4 more free trade wrld. Not anti Europe. #46SGS
Text.2315: European Union is a political project. Britain believes in self governance. Lord Griffiths of Fforestfach #BREXIT #46SGS #debategrowth
Text.2316: European Union is a disfunctional entity. Not able to controll its borders. Lord Griffiths of Fforestfach #BREXIT #46SGS #debategrowth
Text.2317: Recap of yesterday's and today's discussions @SG__Symposium https://t.co/pE67WOnAaF #46SGS #debategrowth
Text.2318: Zusammenfassung zum 46. @SG__Symposium. Berichte, Interviews und Videos: https://t.co/z3lVmCaq9F #46SGS #debategrowth
Text.2319: There are also going to be social implications of how we r going to interact with the machines and with each other. @MFordFuture #46SGS
Text.2320: All kinds of industries are going to be impacted. @MFordFuture #46SGS
Text.2321: We will have to decouple jobs and the sense of fulfillment we r getting through them. @MFordFuture #46SGS #debategrowth
Text.2322: Jobs that involve genuine creativity & skilled trade workers like nurses and plumbers r less likely to being replaced. @MFordFuture #46SGS
Text.2323: We have a moral imperative to make sure automation doesn't get out of hand. @MFordFuture #46SGS
Text.2324: W/ basic income we have 2 b careful w/ t/ amount. We don't want to create a strong disincentive to work. @MFordFuture #46SGS
Text.2325: Any kind of white collar knowledge work will be replaced by robots. @MFordFuture #46SGS #debategrowth @SG__Symposium
Text.2326: How do u stay relevant? Focus on things that r more creative. Don't invest time in skills that r fundamentally routine. @MFordFuture #46SGS
Text.2327: Collaboration with robots rather than being replaced by them? That's true for some sort of workforce. @MFordFuture #46SGS
Text.2328: We need to find new structures that generate income.  @MFordFuture @SG__Symposium #46SGS #debategrowth
Text.2329: Until today machines worked routine and were predictable. Now machines are beginning to think. @MFordFuture #46SGS #debategrowth
Text.2330: Technology is becoming far more capable. @MFordFuture #46SGS #debategrowth
Text.2331: Now on stage: @MFordFuture speaking on the rise of the #robots. #46SGS #debategrowth
Text.2332: Study: “Global Perspectives Barometer 2016” by @GfK and @SG__Symposium: #Digitalnatives demand new decision making paradigm. #46SGS

Text.2335: Zusammenfassung der Rede von Prof. @ProfTimJackson über eine «post-growth economy» am @SG__Symposium: https://t.co/u0idGvktae. #46SGS
Text.2336: Fundamentals of what makes Philippines the Philippines still there. Not worried this will change w/ opening up 2 globalisation. Cesar #46SGS
Text.2337: Q. Is overseas work as foundation of economy sustainable? A: Skilled overseas workers r source of strength for Philip. C. Purisima.#46SGS
Text.2338: Inequality between rich and poor is widening at the moment in the Philippines. Cesar Purisima #46SGS #debategrowth
Text.2339: U have 2 invest in fundamentals 2 keep poorest at work & children in schools. We r addressing t/ constrains to growth. Cesar Purisima #46SGS
Text.2340: Now: One-on-one with Cesar Purisima, Secretary of the Philippine Department of Finance, and Stephen Sackur @BBCNews #46SGS
Text.2341: Q: Climate change as a threat? We have 2 create mechanisms 2 make it attractive 4 companies 2 invest in ren. energies. @Maersk  #46SGS
Text.2342: How do you address problem of increasing inequality? A.:We create partnerships 2 ensure access 2 medical treatments. C. Franz @Roche  #46SGS
Text.2343: Q. fr. audience: what r you doing 2 support women on the boards? A.: Ensure good maternity leave condition. Nils Sm. Andersen @Maersk #46SGS
Text.2344: You have to be able to tell your workforce: we will grow. Peter Brabeck-Letmathe @Nestle #46SGS
Text.2345: In our business it's a question of survival to be innovative. Christoph Franz @Roche #46SGS
Text.2346: Growth opportunities have never been better. It´s about defining the business models for growth. Nils Smedegaard Andersen @Maersk #46sgs
Text.2347: We need growth model that is less ressource intensive. This is a management issue. Peter Brabeck-Letmathe @Nestle #46sgs #debategrowth
Text.2348: 2/2 Baron David de Rothschild, Christoph Franz @Roche #46sgs #debategrowth
Text.2349: Now: Panel on the tops and the flops of future growth.   Nils Smedegaard Andersen @MaerskLine, Peter Brabeck-Letmathe @Nestle 1/2 #46sgs
Text.2350: Lord Griffiths asks panel: could you actually say: I don't believe in growth? #46SGS
Text.2351: Cheap money is not sustainable growth. Doris Leuthard @SG__Symposium #46SGS #debategrowth
Text.2352: We need to care about inequality and inclusive growth. Need to invest in research and education. Doris Leuthard @SG__Symposium #46SGS
Text.2353: Now on stage: Vice President and Federal Councillor of the Swiss Confederation: Doris Leuthard.  #46SGS
Text.2354: Are the young the new labour market slaves? Question that was raised during 1st debate @SG__Symposium #46SGS #debategrowth
Text.2355: We have to improve the quality of public investment. Markus J. Beyrer #46SGS #debategrowth
Text.2356: We don't have enough public investment in Europe. Markus J. Beyrer. #46SGS #debategrowth
Text.2357: Watch the discussions @SG__Symposium via their livestream here: https://t.co/J8XzFDSjQe #46SGS #debategrowth
Text.2358: Growth linked to #innovation. Q. is not whether we need growth, but what kind of growth we need. Markus J. Beyrer #46SGS #debategrowth
Text.2359: What can we do about increasing growth if we don't increase wages of the people? Luca Visentini @SG__Symposium #46SGS #debategrowth
Text.2360: Populists on rise in Europe, because people r afraid of future. Should think abt setting up diff. model for growth. Luca Visentini #46SGS
Text.2361: The case for faster growth w/ Markus J. Beyrer, Dir. General @BUSINESSEUROPE & Luca Visentini, Gen. Secr., Europ. Trade Union Conf. #46SGS
Text.2362: More fun, less stuff: it isn't about #economic #growth in the 1st place but about #prosperity. @ProfTimJackson #46SGS #debategrowth
Text.2363: How to slow down growth? Enterprise as service. Decent work. Regenerative investment as an act of commitment. #46sgs #debategrowth
Text.2365: Are there limits to growth? #Growth may have it's very own internal limits. @ProfTimJackson #46SGS #debategrowth
Text.2366: Now speaking on the case for slower #growth: Prof. Tim Jackson @UniOfSurrey #46SGS #debategrowth
Text.2367: How do we make sure that #economic #growth is inclusive? Lord Griffiths of Fforestfach #46sgs #debategrowth
